content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Chandler, Joey, Rachel, and Phoebe are standing around the table drinking champagne as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, what’s going on?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I found a note on my door, “Come to Monica’s quick, bring champagne and a Three Musketeers bar.”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah I’ll take that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s up?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica and I are engaged.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God. (Hugs Chandler.) Congratulations.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Where is she?
[Cut to Monica out on the balcony.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m engaged!!!!!! I’m engaged!!!!
content.parenthetical: yelling at the top of her lungs

content.text: [Cut back inside.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, she’s been out there for twenty minutes, I’m surprised you didn’t hear her on the way over.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I thought it was just a kid yelling, “I’m gay! I’m gay!” Can I bring her in?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no, let her stay out there. It’s sweet.
[Cut to Monica.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m getting married!!!! I’m gonna be a bride!!!! (Someone else yells at her.) No, I will not shut up because I’m engaged! (He yells again.) Ohh, big talk! Huh, why don’t you come over here and say that to me?! Huh, buddy?! Yeah, my fianc�e will kick your ass! (Chandler starts to look worried.) Come on, apartment 20! Apartment 20!
[Cut back inside.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, you get her in here. (To Joey) You bolt the door. I’ll be in the closet.

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, continued from earlier, everyone is now in the living room drinking champagne.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay! Wait-wait-wait! Shhh! (Bangs on her class with a spoon to make a toast.) Okay, umm, I just wanna say that…I love you guys so-so much and-and thank you for being here on my special night. (Chandler clears his throat.) Our special night. I mean it just wouldn’t be my—our-our night, if you all weren’t here to celebrate with me—us—Damnit!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s okay, I want this to be your night too. (Raises his class.) To Monica.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Awww, come on—wait—stop it. Okay, to Monica.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: To Monica!
(They all say to Monica, clink their glasses, and drink.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So have you decided on a band for the wedding? Because, y’know, I’m kinda musical.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah Pheebs, honey, she just got engaged a couple of hours ago. I doubt she’s even had time to…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well speaking of chiming in, remember the time you burned down my apartment?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, you’re on your own.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what we should do? We should all get dressed up and go to have champagne at The Plaza .
(They all agree and start to go and get ready.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But I-I-I can’t stay too long, I gotta get up early for a commercial audition tomorrow and I gotta look good. I’m supposed to be playing a 19-year-old. (Everyone stops in their tracks upon hearing this.) What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So when you said, “Get up early,” did you mean 1986?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You guys don’t think I look 19?
(A brief silence ensues.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, 19! We thought you said 90!
(They all politely laugh and stop just as quickly.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay everybody, let’s go! Let’s go!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.
(They all leave and Joey comes back in quickly.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, is uh the rest of my candy bar around here?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh honey no, you ate it all.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I was afraid of that.
(Walks out and after he closes the door Phoebe turns around and takes a bite out of what is left of his candy bar.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s bedroom, they’re getting ready.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what shoes would look great with this ring? Diamond shoes! (Sees Chandler sitting on the bed.) You’re not getting dressed. (Chandler quietly folds over the comforter on the bed making a spot for her.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Know what I mean?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, but I don’t think we have time.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There’s gonna be a wedding. You’re gonna be the bride. Two hundred people are going to be looking at you in a clean white dress.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Let’s do it! (She kisses him and they fall back onto the bed.)

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, time lapse, Chandler is fully dressed and slowly walking out of the bedroom with a distressed look on his face.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler! It happens to lots of guys! You-you-you were probably tired, you had a lot of champagne, don’t worry about it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not worried, I’m uh, I’m fascinated. Y’know it’s like uh, Biology! Which is funny because in high school I uh, I-I failed Biology and tonight Biology failed me. (Exits as Phoebe enters from her room with her guitar.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Check it out. Okay, I can play this when the guests are coming in. Okay. (Singing)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: If you would’ve let me finish, it goes on to say that he’s probably not gay.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Chandler is looking at the foosball table.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sure, you guys don’t have this problem, you’re made of wood. (Rachel comes out of the bathroom) Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You look great!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, thanks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You okay over there?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know, y’know? I feel a little umm… No, y’know what? Never mind, I’m gonna be fine.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, don’t worry about it I mean you probably were tired, you had a lot of champagne, it happens to everybody.
[Rachel exits into the hallway just as Ross is coming up the stairs.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! Happy Monica’s night!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well thank you, you too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, do you believe this? Do you believe they are actually getting married?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well sure. But I get married all the time so…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I guess. I-I… I mean, do-do you think we’re ever gonna have that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You mean, we—you and me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no-no-no-no-no, no, no! We, you with someone and me with someone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh good, you scared me for a minute.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Shake it off.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I mean—no, it’s just ‘cause, it’s just ’cause you and I were like a nightmare. (Screams.) No, but there was some good times.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, absolutely. Y’know like it was umm…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Surely you can think of something good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, just give me a minute! (Thinking) Oh well, yes, I can think of one good thing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well you uh, you were always really good at the uh, at the uh the stuff.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah? I was good at the stuff huh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-hmm, uh-hmm, yeah, yeah, I really liked your hands.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My hands?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Way to go guys. Y’know, you-you were really good at the stuff too.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I know. Hey, y’know what we never did? (Ross looks at her.) Oh no, not that. (Ross nods okay.) We uh, we never had a bonus night!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know, bonus night. Y’know, when two people break up but they get back together for just one night.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: One night, just-just sex. No strings attached?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah-yeah, we never had that,

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.
[Silence.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, this is getting a little crazy. I mean, I’m-I’m sure it would be amazing but I…gotta say I really-really don’t think it would be a good idea. Y’know? I really, really…don’t.

content.description: [Scene: Joey and Rachel’s, Chandler is playing Playstation, Crash Team Racing to be exact (he’s in last on Hot Air Skyway to be more exact) as Joey enters from his room desperately trying to look like a 19-year-old. He’s got the wool cap, he’s got the cut-off Knicks jersey over the faded T-shirt, and he’s got the whole pants-around-the-knees-showing-off-the-boxers thing that rich, white, suburban kids have adopted in a desperate and extremely futile attempt to try to look like they’re from the inner-city.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: ‘Sup? ‘Sup dude?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Take whatever you want, just please don’t hurt me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So you’re playing a little Playstation , huh? That’s whack! Playstation is whack! ‘Sup with the whack Playstation , ‘sup?! Huh? Come on, am I 19 or what?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, on a scale from 1 to 10, 10 being the dumbest a person can look, you are definitely 19.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on man, really how old?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Young! You’re a man-child okay?! Now go get changed because everybody’s ready and please, oh please, keep my underwear!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow thanks! (He goes into his bedroom and closes the door.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joe?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, you’ve had a lot of sex right?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: When? Today? Some, not a lot.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, it’s just the reason that I’m asking is because I kind of eh, uh, I was unable to—I mean I really wanted to, but I couldn’t… There huh—hmm, there-there was an incident.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Don’t worry about that man, that happens.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s happened to you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Once.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, what’d you do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I did it anyway.

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Monica is in the living room and Phoebe is in her room.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe! Come on! Let’s go! (Knocks on her door.) Come on! (Phoebe enters with guitar and not ready to go.) Why aren’t you dressed yet?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m sorry, but I just wrote the best dance song for your wedding. Check this out. (Gets ready to play.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, Phoebe, I’ll tell you what, if you get ready now I’ll let you play it at the wedding.
content.parenthetical: grabs the guitar away from her

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really?! Oh that’s so exciting! Thank you! Thanks Mon! Oh but Mon, if you touch my guitar again I’ll have to pound on you for a little bit.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Fair enough, now go get ready!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (She goes to get ready.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ll get everybody else (Does so), finally we can start celebrating my—(She gasps and is stopped by the sight of Ross and Rachel making out in the hall.) I’m sorry, uh apparently I’ve opened the door to the past.

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, continued from before the commercial break. Monica is walking into the apartment followed by Ross and Rachel.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, Monica. Mon, uh what-what you just saw…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Can I ask you just a little question, huh? Why tonight?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: See, I’ve been waiting my whole life to be engaged, and unlike some people I’m only planning on doing this once. So, uh y’know, maybe this is selfish and I’m sorry about it, but I was kinda hoping tonight could just be about that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh honey, but it is just about…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It is! It is!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No it’s not! No! No! Now it’s about you and Ross getting back together!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: See yeah umm, you kinda stole my thunder!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay! Ho-ho! We did not steal your thunder because we are not getting back together!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. No. And you know what? Nobody even saw!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s true.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey I swear it we just kissed.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It was just a kiss. (Phoebe enters and overhears this.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys kissed!!!!! What does this mean?!! Are you, are you getting back together?! Can I sing at your wedding?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thunder being stolen!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay come on Phoebe, it’s nothing! Monica, come on!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look let’s not make a big deal out of this! It was a one time thing. It doesn’t even matter!
(Chandler and Joey enter and overhear that.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God! I cannot believe you guys are talking about this! The problems in the bedroom are between the man and the woman!!! All right?!! Now Chandler is doing the best he can!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t think that’s what they were talking about Joe!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What a great night, Chandler can’t do it, these guys kissed… (Points to Ross and Rachel.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You guys kissed! Oh my—this is huge!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh no!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No-no, it’s really not huge.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And; people thinking it’s huge has led Monica to believe that we are stealing her thunder. (To Monica) Which we are not!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, we’re still talking about it, aren’t we?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well yeah, that and Chandler’s problem.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Monica-Monica-Monica-Monica, listen-listen, listen, listen, would-would it make you feel better if we all stop talking about Ross and Rachel.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes that would be lovely.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You got it. Okay. Now, I can pass for 19 right?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, you can pass for 19.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Seriously?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Seriously? Seriously, no! You can play your own age which is 31!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, you are not! You’re 31.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Aww crap!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, so The Plaza ! Okay, we’ll get us some Mai Thai’s, (To Chandler) maybe no more for you though.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what? I-I think that umm, I don’t feel like going to The Plaza .

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, Monica, this is ridiculous! Look…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No-no, I-I really don’t want to talk about it! I don’t! (To Rachel) Especially with you. (Goes into her room.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Psss, that is whack!
[Time lapse, Phoebe is playing the guitar for Joey.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah? (Joey nods yes.) Okay, I think I’ll play it at the wedding.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Well, I think we’ll see if they actually let you play. Huh? I mean they tell you anything you want to hear like-like, “You look 19,” and then they just take it away like-like, “No you don’t.”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I don’t think Monica is gonna take this away.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wouldn’t she?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Would she?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Would she? (He smells something and gasps as he realizes what it is.) You ate my candy bar!

content.description: Rachel’s bedroom, she’s pacing as Ross knocks on her door and opens it a little to stick his hands in.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Guess who? (Enters fully.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, I just realized we kinda left some stuff up in the air…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What do you think Monica meant when she said she didn’t want to talk, especially with me? I mean, why not especially you and me? We were both out there kissing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Still thinking about it huh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on! Serious-ser-ser-seriously, what did she mean by that? (Mimicking Monica.) Especially you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, who cares?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I care!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And so do I.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know what, I-I have to go talk to her, would you let me just get changed?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. Sure. (Sits down on her bed.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Am I going to let you watch me undress?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! (Exits.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s bedroom, they are both getting undressed.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe her, y’know it’s just—it’s so typical.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Now Monica, I know you’re upset, but don’t forget. There is going to be a wedding, you are going to throw the bouquet, and then there’s going to be a honeymoon, maybe in Paris.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Paris?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We will take a moonlit walk on the Rue de la (mumbles something).

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Keep talking.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Then we will sprinkle rose pedals on the bed and make love. Not just because it’s romantic, but because I can!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I love you!
(They start making out and both start to feel something growing below the belt line.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bonjour, monsieur.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, don’t say anything, you might scare it away.
(There is a knock on the door.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s Paris, who knows we’re here!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi Pheebs, what’s up? (She enters.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, you said I could sing at your wedding so, I’m just gonna need a small deposit.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know, just some good faith money to hold the date.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Pheebs, we’re not giving you a deposit for our wedding!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I see. (Exits angrily.)
[Cut to the living room, Joey is eating a sandwich.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They break your heart, don’t they?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know, I don’t really need their permission.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! If you wanna sing at their wedding, well you sing at their wedding!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! And if you wanna look 19, then you… You gotta do something about your eyes.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?! What’s wrong with my eyes.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: They give you away! There’s just-there’s just too much wisdom in there. (Joey nods in agreement.) Just put some tea bags on there for like 15 minutes.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And that’ll get rid of my wisdom?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Maybe just 10 minutes for you.
[Cut back to Monica and Chandler’s room, they are making out again as there’s another knock on the door.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, give her the deposit! Give her the ring! I don’t care!
(Monica opens the door to Ross and Rachel.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, what did you mean before when you said you didn’t want to talk to anyone, especially me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What a great apology! (To Monica) And you accept! Okay, bye-bye!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No-no, seriously-seriously, what was the especially me part about?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, let’s just say it’s not the first time you’ve stolen my thunder.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, here’s a thought.
(Rachel ignores him and follows Monica into the kitchen.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, what are you talking about?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: My Sweet Sixteen! Remember, you went to third base with my cousin Charlie.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ahh, third base.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s all everybody at the party could talk about!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, y’know what? The only reason I did that was because your party was so boring!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We had a caricaturist!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh!!
(Exits.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, your Sweet Sixteen was like a million years ago.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And yet, here we are doing it again.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh, Monica I don’t want to steal your stupid thunder!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh please! Why else would you have made out with Ross?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Got me. (He shows of his hands.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, easy mimey, the moment has passed, it ain’t gonna happen!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I just thought it would be nice if I could have just this one night!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I swear, I never wanted any part of your night!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, is that why you did it in the secret hallway where nobody ever goes?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, Rachel, I’ve been thinking. I don’t think us getting together tonight is such a good idea. I’m calling it off.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why to save your dignity my man.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, why? Why would I ever want to take away from your night?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know! I don’t—maybe you’re feeling a little resentful. Maybe ah, maybe you thought you’d get married first! Maybe you can’t stand the fact that your formerly fat friend is getting married before you!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh wow. That—y’know what? That is so unfair. Y’know what? Now I want to steal your thunder! Come on Ross, let’s go have sex!
(Ross tries to dismiss it by making that sound, but decides to go for it and follows Rachel.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe you’re gonna have sex on my engagement night!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, somebody should. (Monica glares at him.)
[Cut to Rachel’s bedroom.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look uh, if we’re gonna do this…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We’re not gonna do this, all right? She’s just gonna think that we’re doin’ it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I see, so everybody wins.
(There’s a knock on the door.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Who is it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s Monica, open up!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay well Ross! Stop it please! Wait a minute! (Motions for him to follow her lead, but he angrily shakes his head no. So she pokes him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oww!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, you like that baby? (Monica bursts in followed by Chandler.) May we help you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I just wanted to say that I hope you do have sex tonight and I hope that you guys get back together, but I must warn you, the night that you announce your engagement I’m going to announce that I’m pregnant!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How is that ever going to happen?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right Monica, do you want to know why I was with Ross tonight?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know why!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No you don’t know why!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay! Why?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because! Because I was sad.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What do you mean?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look, I am so…so happy for you guys, but you getting married just reminds me of the fact that I’m not. I’m not even close. And I don’t know, maybe I just wanted to make myself feel better. And I know that that’s dumb, but oh my God you were so depressed when Ross got married that you slept with Chandler!
(Ross looks at Chandler.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t care, she slept with me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Anyway sweetie, I am, I’m so sorry I ruined your night.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry I almost made you sleep with Ross. (They hug.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I’m going to take off. (To Chandler) Congratulations man.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And uh, Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What can I say, you missed your chance. From now on the only person who’s going to enjoy these bad boys (holds up his hands) is me. (Quickly realizes what he said and exits disgustedly.)

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Phoebe is singing outside Monica and Chandler’s door.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! Here’s a dollar, consider it a deposit. Please sing at our wedding.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh thank you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (Goes back to bed.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Now… (Starts singing again) “ Who will perform the ceremony! Who will perform the cer —(Chandler enters and grabs her guitar and closes the door behind him)—Oh—oh! All right, I’ll pound on him in the morning.
